topic.title: How to configure triggers for operations

para.text: How to configure triggers for operations

para.style: text-align:left; text-indent:48px; margin-top:0px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:0px; line-height:1.00; background-color:#ffffff; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; tabstops:none;
para.text: Triggers for operations are a powerful tool for implementing your business-processes.

para.style: text-align:left; text-indent:48px; margin-top:0px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:0px; line-height:1.00; background-color:#ffffff; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; tabstops:none;
para.text: To each operation, you can link up your set of triggers, which will run at the time of execution of operation. Triggers can be of three types: first types are executed before the basic operations (immediately before the execution of operation and change in the state of task), others — in place of the basic action and third ones — after the execution of the action.
